comments.body: we probably don't need this, since it's also specified in config-test.sh?

comments.body: Ah, it's the runner that it was missing. I was trying to add all those provider-envs, and job-envs and thought it was not manageable.

the project in this yaml section (kubernetes-e2e-features) has nothing to do with the gce project declared in e2e.sh I'm assuming? (because only that one has quota). This is the jenkins master project?
`e2e.sh` declares Bash variables & configuration; this file tells Jenkins to actually run a job with this name.
ah, so project is just overloaded i guess

comments.body:
we may not want this to email oncall until it's fixed.

or maybe we do? :)

It's currently set to email $DEFAULT_RECIPIENTS, so this doesn't change anything.

I think I remember it used to email just you. Should I set you as the job owner and have it email you?
if it's already emailing $DEFAULT_RECIPIENTS then this seems fine to me.

comments.body: I wonder if maybe we should keep the GKE builds separate here? Having the GKE-specific text and then immediately overriding it for the gce- builds seems weird.
Agreed, fixed. I also had some of  the descriptions wrong, that's fixed now too.
